alert.note: Alert for Antelope; Boone (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 11 at 3:22AM CST until January 12 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 PM CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM SATURDAY TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory snow accumulations between 2 and 5 inches are expected. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. The coldest wind chills are expected Saturday night into Sunday morning. * WHERE...Antelope and Boone Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 3 PM this afternoon to 6 PM CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to noon CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 3 AM Saturday to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. Areas of blowing snow will reduce visibilities, even after snow has stopped falling. The hazardous conditions will impact the Thursday evening and Friday commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
